name: ls
description: List directory contents with detailed information, including hidden files and human-readable sizes. Essential for navigating and inspecting file systems.

variations.description: List all files in long format with human-readable sizes.
Long listing format (permissions, owner, size, date).
Long listing, reverse time order (show newest last).

name: grep
description: Search for patterns in files recursively. Supports regular expressions.

variations.description: Search recursively for a pattern starting at a given path.
Show 5 lines of context AFTER the matching line.

name: find
description: Search for files and directories in a directory hierarchy.

variations.description: Find files by name within a path.
Find files modified more than 7 days ago.
Display all processes running on the system (BSD syntax).
Display all processes running on the system (Standard syntax).
Find a specific process and exclude the grep command itself.

name: top
description: Display and update sorted information about running processes.

name: htop
description: Interactive process viewer and system monitor. More user-friendly than top.

variations.description: View processes for a specific user.

name: netstat
description: Display network connections, routing tables, and statistics (Legacy).

variations.description: Show listening TCP/UDP ports with PID/program name.
Show all connections and listening ports (numerical addresses).

name: ss
description: Socket statistics utility - modern replacement for netstat.

variations.description: Show listening TCP/UDP sockets with PID/program name.
Capture traffic on interface eth0, port 80 (numerical output).
Capture all traffic and save to a file.
Capture traffic to/from a specific host and port.

name: iptables
description: Display firewall rules with verbose output.

variations.description: List all rules in all tables, numerical output, verbose.
Flush (delete) all rules in the current table (DANGEROUS).
List rules in the NAT table.
Owner rwx, Group r-x, Others r-x.
Add execute permission to all users.
Recursively set permissions to rw- r-- r--.
Change both the owner and the group.
Recursively change owner and group for a directory.

name: df
description: Display disk space usage in human-readable format.

name: du
description: Display disk usage of files and directories.

variations.description: Show disk usage for all files, not just directories.
Show usage for current level and direct subdirectories.
Create a gzipped archive (c) with filename (f).
List the contents of an archive file.

name: systemctl
description: Control and query systemd system and service manager.

variations.description: Check the status of a service.
Enable a service to start on boot.

name: journalctl
description: Query and display systemd journal logs.

variations.description: View logs for a service and follow (f) in real-time.
View all log entries with details and explanatory text.
View logs since the beginning of today.

name: tail
description: Display and follow the end of a file in real-time.

variations.description: Follow the file (f) as it grows.

name: less
description: View file contents with scrolling and search capabilities.

variations.description: View file and automatically scroll/follow to the end.
Open file for standard viewing and scrolling.

name: sed
description: Stream editor for filtering and transforming text.

name: awk
description: Pattern scanning and text processing language.

variations.description: Print the first column ($1) of each line.
Use colon (:) as the field separator (F) and print first field.

name: curl
description: Transfer data from or to a server.

variations.description: Download a file and save it with the specified name.

name: ssh
description: Secure shell - connect to remote servers securely.

variations.description: Connect using a specified identity file (i).

name: scp
description: Securely copy files between hosts over SSH.

variations.description: Copy local file to remote host.
Copy remote file to local directory.

name: rsync
description: Sync files and directories efficiently between locations.

variations.description: Archive mode (a), verbose (v), compressed (z) remote sync.
Sync directories, deleting files in destination not found in source.
List all containers, including stopped ones.

name: docker logs
description: Display and follow logs from a Docker container.

variations.description: Display and follow (f) logs in real-time.
Display the last 50 lines of logs.
Get pods in a specific namespace.
Get all primary resources in a namespace.
Get services in the current namespace.

name: kubectl logs
description: Display and follow logs from a Kubernetes pod.

variations.description: Follow (f) logs for a pod in a namespace.
Get logs for a specific container in a pod.
Get logs from a previous instance of the container.

name: free
description: Display memory usage in human-readable format.

variations.description: Display memory usage in human-readable (h) format.
Display a single report since boot.
Display a table of various counters and event totals.
List processes using a specific port (80).
List processes that have a specific file open.
List files opened by a specific user.
Scan (z) ports 1-1000 on a host (verbose v).
Check if a TCP port (80) is open.
Listen (l) on a port (8080) for incoming connections.

name: ping
description: Send ICMP echo requests to test network connectivity.

variations.description: Send continuous pings until manually stopped.

name: traceroute
description: Trace the network path packets take to reach a destination.

variations.description: Do not resolve IP addresses to hostnames (faster).

name: nmap
description: Network mapper - scan ports and detect service versions.

variations.description: Scan all ports (p-) and probe to determine service versions (sV).
Default scan of the top 1000 ports.
Ping scan (sn) to list hosts that are up on a subnet.

name: crontab
description: Edit cron jobs for scheduled task automation.

variations.description: Edit the current user's crontab file.
Schedule a command to run in one hour.

name: kill
description: Force kill a process by PID.

variations.description: Kill processes matching the full command line (f).

name: nohup
description: Run command immune to hangups, in the background.

variations.description: Run command in background, ignoring hangups.
Create a new session with a name (S).
Create a new session with a name (s).
Mount the device to the mount point.
Unmount the device at the mount point.

name: fdisk
description: List all disk partitions with detailed information.

variations.description: List the partition tables for all devices.
Enter the interactive utility for device sda (DANGEROUS).

name: dmesg
description: Display the kernel ring buffer messages.

name: uptime
description: Show how long the system has been running, and load averages.

name: who
description: Display who is logged in to the system.

name: w
description: Show who is logged in and what they are doing.

name: mysql
description: Connect to a MySQL server and run administrative commands.

variations.description: Connect as root user, prompting for password.

name: SHOW PROCESSLIST
description: Display currently executing database connections and queries.

variations.description: Show the first 100 characters of each query.
Show the full text of all currently running queries.

name: nproc
description: Print the number of processing units available.

variations.description: Print the number of processing units available to the current process.
Print the number of installed processors.
Exclude 1 processing unit from the count.

name: ncdu
description: NCurses Disk Usage: An interactive disk usage analyzer that provides a fast, graphical way to see where disk space is being used.

variations.description: Scans the current directory or the specified directory and displays an interactive, navigable list of files and subdirectories sorted by size.
Scans the root directory (/) but **skips directories on different filesystems** (e.g., skips network mounts or /proc). This is recommended for full system scans.
Runs in **read-only mode** (`-r`), preventing accidental file deletions (`d` key) while analyzing disk usage in the `/home` directory.

name: sudo
description: Execute a command as another user, typically the superuser.

variations.description: Run command as a specific user.

name: useradd
description: Create a new user or update default new user information.

variations.description: Create a new user with default settings.
Create user with home directory (-m) and specific shell (-s).
Create user and add to a secondary group.
Delete a user's password (make account passwordless).
Kill all processes with the given name.
Kill all processes owned by a specific user.

name: ip
description: Show / manipulate routing, network devices, interfaces and tunnels.

variations.description: Show IP addresses assigned to all interfaces.

name: crontab
description: Maintain crontab files for individual users.

variations.description: Edit the current user's crontab file.
List the current user's crontab entries.
Run a command and trace its system calls.

name: watch
description: Execute a program periodically, showing output fullscreen.

variations.description: Run command every 2 seconds by default.
Query the IP address of a domain.
Query specific DNS record types (MX, NS, etc.).
Display all interfaces, including down ones.
Show current hostname and system info.

name: mtr
description: Network diagnostic tool combining ping and traceroute.

name: tracepath
description: Traces path to destination discovering MTU along this path.

name: whois
description: Client for the whois directory service.

name: telnet
description: User interface to the TELNET protocol (often used to test ports).

variations.description: Connect to a specific port on a host.
Connect to remote host for file transfer.
Allow incoming traffic on a port.

name: ethtool
description: Query or control network driver and hardware settings.

name: iftop
description: Display bandwidth usage on an interface by host.

variations.description: Monitor bandwidth usage on default interface.
Run in client mode, connecting to host.

name: iw
description: Show / manipulate wireless devices and their configuration.

variations.description: Connect to a TCP port (like netcat).
Add an interface to a bridge.

name: route
description: Show / manipulate the IP routing table (legacy).

variations.description: Move or rename source to destination.
Recursively and forcefully remove a directory.
Remove a directory and its ancestors if they become empty.

name: touch
description: Change file timestamps / create empty files.

variations.description: Update timestamps or create empty file.

name: date
description: Print or set the system date and time.

variations.description: Show calendar for the whole year.
Print info for a specific user.

name: env
description: Run a program in a modified environment / print environment variables.

name: history
description: Display or manipulate the history list.

name: cat
description: Concatenate files and print on the standard output.

variations.description: Create file from stdin (Ctrl+D to save).

name: man
description: An interface to the system reference manuals.

variations.description: Show all matching executables in PATH.

name: shutdown
description: Halt, power-off or reboot the machine.

name: mysql select
examples: SELECT id, name FROM users WHERE id = 1;
SELECT * FROM users ORDER BY created_at DESC LIMIT 10;

variations.description: Select all columns from a table.

variations.syntax: SELECT col1, col2 FROM table_name WHERE condition;
variations.description: Select specific columns with a condition.

variations.syntax: INSERT INTO table (col1, col2) VALUES (val1, val2);
variations.description: Insert a new row with specific values.

name: mysql update
examples: UPDATE users SET email = 'new@example.com' WHERE id = 1;

variations.syntax: UPDATE table SET col = val WHERE condition;

name: mysql create database
examples: CREATE DATABASE IF NOT EXISTS my_app CHARACTER SET utf8mb4;

name: mysql create table
examples: CREATE TABLE users (id INT AUTO_INCREMENT PRIMARY KEY, name VARCHAR(255));
CREATE TABLE logs (id INT, message TEXT) ENGINE=InnoDB;

variations.description: Create a new table with columns.

name: mysql alter table
examples: ALTER TABLE users ADD COLUMN age INT;
ALTER TABLE users DROP COLUMN age;
ALTER TABLE users MODIFY COLUMN name VARCHAR(100);

variations.syntax: ALTER TABLE name ADD COLUMN col type;
variations.description: Add a new column to a table.

variations.syntax: ALTER TABLE name DROP COLUMN col;
variations.description: Remove a column from a table.
Remove all rows from a table (reset auto-increment).
List all databases on the server.
List all tables in the current database.
Show currently running queries and connections.
Terminate only the query running on the connection.
Show replication status in vertical format.
Show binary log file and position.
Show the number of nodes in the cluster.
Show the primary status of the cluster component (Primary/Non-Primary).
Show the state of the local node (Synced, Donor, Joiner, etc.).
Show the IP addresses of all nodes in the cluster.

name: smem
description: Report memory usage with shared memory divided proportionally.

variations.description: Show memory usage in reverse order.

name: slabtop
description: Display kernel slab cache information in real time.

name: pmap
description: Report memory map of a process.

variations.description: Show memory map for process ID.
Show statistics for all CPUs individually.

name: lscpu
description: Display information about the CPU architecture.

name: sar
description: Collect, report, or save system activity information.

variations.description: Print attributes for all block devices.
Print attributes for a specific device.

name: smartctl
description: Control and monitor S.M.A.R.T. enabled hard drives.

variations.description: Show all SMART information for device.

name: badblocks
description: Search a device for bad blocks.

variations.description: Check for bad blocks in verbose mode.

name: fsck
description: Check and repair a Linux filesystem.

variations.description: Attempt to fix detected errors automatically.

name: ioping
description: Simple disk I/O latency monitoring tool.

variations.description: Check I/O latency on current directory.

name: ionice
description: Set or get the I/O scheduling class and priority for a program.

variations.description: Get I/O priority of a process.
Build the package in the current directory.
Build and specify output file name.
Run the package in the current directory.

name: go clean
description: Remove object files and cached files.

variations.description: Remove object files from current directory.
Remove the entire module download cache.

name: go install
description: Compile and install packages and dependencies.

variations.description: Install the package in the current directory.
Install a specific version of a package.

name: go mod init
description: Initialize new module in current directory.

variations.description: Initialize a new module with the given name.

name: go mod tidy
description: Add missing and remove unused modules.

variations.description: Ensure go.mod matches the source code.
Copy dependencies to the vendor directory.

name: go get
description: Add dependencies to current module and install them.

variations.description: List all packages in the current module.
Run tests in the current package.
Format code in the current package.

name: go doc
description: Show documentation for package or symbol.

name: docker run
description: Run a command in a new container.

variations.description: Run a container from an image.

name: docker exec
description: Run a command in a running container.

variations.description: Execute a command in a running container.
Start an interactive shell in a running container.

name: docker stop
description: Stop one or more running containers.

name: docker start
description: Start one or more stopped containers.

name: docker inspect
description: Return low-level information on Docker objects.

variations.description: Inspect a Docker object (container, image, volume, network).

name: docker pull
description: Pull an image or a repository from a registry.

variations.description: Download an image from a registry.

name: docker build
description: Build an image from a Dockerfile.

variations.description: Build image from Dockerfile in current directory.
Remove all unused images not just dangling ones.

name: docker-compose down
description: Stop and remove containers, networks, images, and volumes.

variations.description: Stop and remove resources created by up.
Remove named volumes declared in the volumes section.
Show info for a specific volume.
Show detailed status for a specific volume.

name: gluster volume create
examples: gluster volume create myvol replica 3 server1:/exp1 server2:/exp2 server3:/exp3

variations.syntax: gluster volume create name replica count bricks
gluster volume set volume_name key value
variations.description: Set a tunable option for a volume.
Add a new server to the trusted storage pool.

name: gluster geo-replication
examples: gluster volume geo-replication myvol slave_host::slave_vol create push-pem

variations.syntax: gluster volume geo-replication master slave create

variations.description: Show detailed status of all pools.
Create a new pool with specified vdevs.
Set a property on a dataset.
Create a snapshot of a dataset.
Enter the integrated shell for FRRouting.
Create a new user with a password.
Grant specific privileges to a user.
Revoke specific privileges from a user.
Request specific information from the server.
Connect to a server using SSL/TLS.

name: gluster geo-replication status
examples: gluster volume geo-replication myvol slave_host::slave_vol status

variations.syntax: gluster volume geo-replication master slave status

name: gluster volume heal info
examples: gluster volume heal myvol info healed
gluster volume heal myvol info heal-failed

variations.syntax: gluster volume heal volume_name info healed
variations.description: List files that have been healed.

name: gluster volume bitrot
examples: gluster volume bitrot myvol scrub status

variations.syntax: gluster volume bitrot volume_name scrub status
gluster volume quota volume_name limit-usage path limit
variations.description: Set usage limit for a path.

name: gluster volume remove-brick
description: Remove a brick from a volume.
examples: gluster volume remove-brick myvol server2:/exp2 start
gluster volume remove-brick myvol server2:/exp2 status
gluster volume remove-brick myvol server2:/exp2 commit

variations.syntax: gluster volume remove-brick volume_name brick start
gluster volume remove-brick volume_name brick commit

name: gluster volume replace-brick
description: Replace a brick in a volume.
examples: gluster volume replace-brick myvol server1:/exp1 server1:/new_exp1 commit force

variations.syntax: gluster volume replace-brick volume_name old_brick new_brick commit force
variations.description: Replace a brick with a new one.

name: gluster snapshot create
examples: gluster snapshot create snap1 myvol no-timestamp

variations.description: Create a snapshot of a volume.

name: gluster snapshot restore
description: Restore a volume from a snapshot.

variations.description: Restore volume to the state of the snapshot.
Run the start script defined in package.json.
Run the test script defined in package.json.
Run a custom script defined in package.json.
Create a package.json with default values.
Update all packages to the latest version respecting semver.
Publish the package to the registry.

name: node
description: Run the Node.js REPL or a script.

variations.description: Evaluate the following argument as JavaScript.

name: kubectl apply
description: Apply a configuration to a resource.

variations.description: Apply a configuration change to a resource from a file.
Delete resources by type and name.

name: kubectl describe
description: Show details of a specific resource.

variations.description: Show details of a specific resource or group of resources.

name: kubectl exec
description: Execute a command in a container.

variations.description: Execute a command in a container with an interactive TTY.

name: kubectl port-forward
description: Forward one or more local ports to a pod.

variations.description: Forward one or more local ports to a pod.
Display merged kubeconfig settings or a specified kubeconfig file.
Sets the current-context in a kubeconfig file.
Display addresses of the master and services.

name: kubectl rollout
description: Manage the rollout of a resource.

variations.description: Show the status of the rollout.

name: kubectl scale
description: Set a new size for a Deployment, ReplicaSet, etc.

variations.description: Scale a resource to a new size.
List all resources in the current namespace.
